meanings.definition: The act of remitting something, such as a payment or debt.
meanings.sent1: The remittal of the loan was a relief for the borrower.
meanings.sent2: The company requested a remittal of the outstanding balance.
meanings.sent3: After the remittal of the debt, they felt a weight lifted off their shoulders.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a remittal of any worries he had about the payment.
meanings.sent5: The remittal of the fee was unexpected but greatly appreciated.

meanings.definition: The act of sending something back, such as a case to a lower court for further consideration.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer argued for the remittal of the case to the lower court.
meanings.sent2: The judge approved the remittal of the lawsuit for review.
meanings.sent3: The remittal of the case led to a thorough reevaluation of the evidence.
meanings.sent4: His decision was a remittal of the responsibility to the appropriate authorities.
meanings.sent5: The remittal of the matter allowed for a fairer examination of the facts.

meanings.definition: The act of forgiving or pardoning a sin or offense.
meanings.sent1: The priest offered remittal for their transgressions.
meanings.sent2: She sought remittal for her past mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The remittal of his wrongdoing brought a sense of peace to his heart.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a remittal of any grudges he held.
meanings.sent5: The remittal of their sins was a moment of spiritual renewal.
